definitions.definition: To be or remain suspended.
definitions.example: The lights hung from the ceiling.

definitions.definition: To float, as if suspended.
definitions.example: The smoke hung in the room.

definitions.definition: (of a ball in cricket, tennis, etc.) To rebound unexpectedly or unusually slowly, due to backward spin on the ball or imperfections of the ground.
To hold or bear in a suspended or inclined manner or position instead of erect.
definitions.example: He hung his head in shame.

definitions.definition: To cause (something) to be suspended, as from a hook, hanger, hinges or the like.
definitions.example: Hang those lights from the ceiling.

definitions.definition: To execute (someone) by suspension from the neck.
definitions.example: The culprits were hanged from the nearest tree.

definitions.definition: To be executed by suspension by one's neck from a gallows, a tree, or other raised bar, attached by a rope tied into a noose.
definitions.example: You will hang for this, my friend.

definitions.definition: (used in maledictions) To damn.
To loiter, hang around, to spend time idly.
definitions.example: Are you busy, or can you hang with me?  I didn't see anything, officer. I was just hanging.

definitions.definition: To exhibit (an object) by hanging.
To apply (wallpaper or drywall to a wall).
definitions.example: Let's hang this cute animal design in the nursery.

definitions.definition: To decorate (something) with hanging objects.
definitions.example: Let's hang the nursery with some new wallpaper.

definitions.definition: To remain persistently in one's thoughts.
To prevent from reaching a decision, especially by refusing to join in a verdict that must be unanimous.
definitions.example: One obstinate juror can hang a jury.

definitions.definition: To stop responding to manual input devices such as keyboard and mouse.
definitions.example: The computer has hung again. Not even pressing ++ works.  When I push this button the program hangs.

definitions.definition: To cause (a program or computer) to stop responding.
definitions.example: The program has a bug that can hang the system.

definitions.definition: To cause (a piece) to become vulnerable to capture.
definitions.example: If you move there, you'll hang your rook.

definitions.definition: To be vulnerable to capture.
definitions.example: In this standard opening position White has to be careful because the pawn on e4 hangs.

definitions.definition: Of a pitcher, to throw a hittable off-speed pitch.
Suspended.
definitions.example: The hanging vines made the house look older than it was.

definitions.definition: (of a piece) Unprotected and exposed to capture.
(of an off-speed pitch) Hittable; poorly executed by the pitcher hence relatively easy to hit.
definitions.example: hanging breaking ball

definitions.definition: (of a person) ugly; very unattractive
The act of hanging a person (or oneself) by the neck in order to kill that person (or to commit suicide).
definitions.example: Hanging is the punishment for one convicted of war crimes, there.

definitions.definition: A sometimes public event at which a person is hanged.
definitions.example: The hanging of the bandits was attended by the whole village.

definitions.definition: Anything that is hung as a decorative element (such as curtains, gobelins or posters).
definitions.example: The various hangings on that Christmas tree look nice.

definitions.definition: The way in which hangings (decorations) are arranged.
definitions.example: I dislike the cramped hanging in the gallery of 18th century painters.

synonyms: a quick drop and a sudden stop
